STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 18, 2020
John Keller
Alpena/Montmorency DHHS
711 West Chisholm Street
Alpena, MI 49707
RE: License #: CP040200941
Alpena/Montmorency DHHS
711 West Chisholm Street
Alpena, MI 49707
Dear Mr. Keller:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 4/16/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior Corrective Action Plan failed to
achieve compliance.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, area manager, at 616.552.3662.
Sincerely,
Bill White, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5037
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT

Services

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS: Due to Coronavirus and Governor’s executive
orders, this inspection did not include face to face contact.
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R400.12413(1)(f) Medical and dental care policy.
Rule 413. (1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy shall,
at a minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any treatment
required for each child who is 4 years of age and older,
including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months before placement or a
new dental examination shall be completed not more than 90
calendar days after placement.
One of four Initial Service Plans reviewed the ISP did not document a dental
examination within 12 months before placement or a new dental examination
completed not more than 90 calendar days after placement. ●Placement occurred
on 7/12/19 and the dental occurred on 11/1/19; 111 days later.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
R400.12418(2)(a) Development of service plans.
Rule 418. (1) An agency shall develop service plans with the
child, the child’s parents or legal guardian, the referring agency,
and other parties involved in providing needed services, or
medical care, unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
4

One of four Initial Service Plans reviewed was not completed within 30 calendar
days from removal from the home. ●ISP 1/23/20-2/21/20 completed on 2/22/20; 1
day late.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
R400.12418(2)(b) Development of service plans.
Rule 418. (1) An agency shall develop service plans with the
child, the child’s parents or legal guardian, the referring agency,
and other parties involved in providing needed services, or
medical care, unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Five of 16 Updated Service Plans were not completed within 120 calendar days after
the initial removal and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
●USP 11/20/19-2/13/20 returned to worker for re-work on 2/19/20 and still in
progress; USP 5/24/19-8/21/19 not completed until 9/18/19; 28 days late.
●USP 11/8/19-2/5/20 completed on 2/19/20 which is 14-days late.
●USP 11/8/19-2/5/20 completed on 2/19/20 which is 14-days late.
●USP 2/18/19-5/18/19 completed on 5/23/19; 5 days late.
This is a repeat violation from your Renewal CAP approved 7/11/2019
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
5

FOM 801 Medical Passports
For each child in foster care the supervising agency must
maintain a medical passport containing all items listed in MCL
722.954c.
Two of seven cases reviewed were missing medical passports.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
FOM 722-08 Supervisory Approval - ISP
Supervisory Approval
Prior to finalizing, the ISP along with the required assessments
must be reviewed and approved by the foster care supervisor
only after a face-to-face meeting with the foster care worker.
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
• Review and approve the ISP within 14 calendar days of the
Report Date.
The agency is considered out of compliance with licensing rule
R400.12403(2)(o) if the foster care supervisor signature date is
past the 14-day review and approval time frame.
One of four Initial Service Plans reviewed was not approved within 14 calendar days
of the Report Date. ISP 1/23/20-2/21/20 missing supervisor signature.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
FOM 722-09 Supervisory Approval - USP
Prior to finalizing, the USP along with the required assessments
(FANS, CANS, etc.) must be reviewed and approved by the
foster care supervisor only after a face-to-face meeting with the
foster care worker.
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
• Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report date.
6

The agency is considered out of compliance with licensing rule
R400.12403(2)(o) if the foster care supervisor signature date is
past the 14-day review and approval time frame.
Four of 16 Updated Service Plans were not signed by the supervisor within 14
calendar days of the report date.
●USP 11/20/19-2/13/20 returned to worker for re-work on 2/19/20 and still in
progress; 2/23/19-5/23/19 not approved by supervisor until 7/2/19 26 days after the
required 14-days.
●USP 5/19/19-8/15/19 approved by supervisor on 10/17/19 - 49 days beyond 14-day
time frame; USP 11/14/19-2/11/20 approved by supervisor on 3/18/19 22-days
beyond 14-day time frame.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
Caregiver
The individual activities required by the foster parent/caregiver
to meet the specific individual needs of the child placed in their
home are included in the PATP. The foster parent/caregiver
must be included in the PATP process. The foster
parent/caregiver signature is required and indicates that the
foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and agrees to the
activities required to meet the needs of the child in their care.
Two of sixteen USP’s reviewed were not signed by the foster parent/caregiver. USP
5/19/19-8/15/19 and USP 11/14/19-2/11/20.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Parents and Youth
over 14-Years Old
Upon completion of the parent-agency treatment plan and
service agreement, the parent is given a copy for review. Foster
care workers need to ensure the parent understands all areas
within the agreement. Parents and youths age 14 and older
must sign the PATP.
7

Two of 16 Updated Service Plans reviewed were not signed by the youth, age 14 or
older.
●USP 8/10/19-11/7/19 and USP 11/8/19-2/5/20.
●USP 5/19/19-8/15/19 and USP 11/14/19-2/11/20.
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
FOM 722-06B FTM PRACTICE GUIDANCE
• Providing the DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, to all
participants (in person and by phone), legal parents, and
casework supervisor. These documents must also be uploaded
into MISACWIS.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the FTM.
Two of seven case files reviewed the worker did not enter the FTM information in
MiSACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the FTM.
This is a repeat violation from your Renewal CAP approved 7/11/2019
On 4/16/2020 you submitted an acceptable corrective action plan. No further
corrective action is necessary.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of the
following information:
(h) Recommendations regarding licensing action and any
required corrective action.
One of two special investigations reviewed, it was not clear that the foster family
received notification that the CAP was completed.
Technical assistance was provided. Recommended the agency issue a letter to the
foster parent indicating the signed CAP has been complied with and completed.
8

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: none requested
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Renewal - June 12, 2019 – CAP approved July 11, 2019
●R 400.12418 DEVELOPMENT OF SERVICE PLANS.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at least
once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
●FOM 722-06B FTM PRACTICE GUIDANCE
Documentation
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the FTM.
These have violations were cited again in this Interim review.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
5/08/2020
________________________________________
Bill White Date
Licensing Consultant
9

Approved By:
May 18, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
